entry.title: Kids' Luggage Travel Hacks: The Ultimate Guide to Keep Everyone Traveling Smoothly
entry.summary:
Simplify packing and traveling with kids! Discover Away's essential checklist and tips for easily organizing clothes, toys, and toiletries for a smooth family vacation.

More
entry.content:
Planning a family vacation should spark excitement—not stress. But if packing for yourself and the kids feels like a logistical nightmare, you're not alone. Between organizing outfits, lugging gear, and keeping track of it all once you arrive, family travel can quickly get complicated. That’s where the right luggage makes all the difference. At Away, we’ve gathered expert tips (and travel-tested gear) to help you stay organized, pack smarter, and actually enjoy the journey.

Small Hands, Big Responsibilities: Let Them Pull Their Weight

If you travel a lot, your kids may already be used to pulling their own carry-on or backpack. Allowing your kids to help not only lightens your load—it gives them a sense of pride and ownership. For little travelers eager to manage their own belongings, smaller-sized kids' luggage is the perfect solution, offering independence and a sense of responsibility. At Away, we’ve created kids' luggage that has all of the durability and style of our award-winning suitcases, perfectly sized-down to fit even your smallest explorer. Our kids luggage comes in fun, child-friendly colors and is equipped with 360° spinner wheels, adjustable trolley handle, and a lightweight yet durable exterior. Our full Kid’s Collection is here to make travel days an exciting adventure, empowering children to feel like confident explorers.

The Kids Carry-on

This kid-sized version of our classic hard-shell suitcase is durable, big enough to fit what they need, but compact enough for them to handle on their own. With adjustable trolley height options, kids can comfortably maneuver the suitcase, while adults can extend it to match the height of their own Away luggage—ensuring a smoother experience for travelers of all sizes.

Kids Backpack

Pair their carry-on with a backpack to keep essentials close at hand. While the suitcase handles the bulk of their packing, a backpack is perfect for in-transit must-haves—like snacks, toys, and entertainment. Our new kids’ backpack is thoughtfully designed with a place for just about everything, including:

  • Water bottle pockets on both sides
  • Exterior pockets
  • Chest strap and no-slip backpack straps
  • Webbing grab handle for hanging 
  • Padded sleeve for tablets or books
  • D-ring to add their favorite charms
  • Trolley sleeve to attach seamlessly to The Kids Carry-On

Kids Lunchbox

Tossing snacks into a backpack or suitcase? That’s a recipe for crushed chips and sticky surprises. That’s why we designed the Kids Lunchbox—to keep meals fresh, organized, and mess-free from takeoff to lunchtime. It’s perfectly sized to fit most popular lunch containers (including bento boxes), with thoughtful features like a zippered pocket for utensils, an elastic mesh lid for snacks, and a compartment for an ice pack. Whether you’re heading to the schoolyard or 30,000 feet up, it’s everything you need to pack a meal—without the mess.

The Convenience of One Large Bag

Even if your kids are ready to roll their own luggage, checking one large bag—like The Trunk—can be a game-changer for families of four or more.  Strategically packing one large suitcase with a comprehensive checklist can be the key to organized and stress-free family travel. In your checked bag, include the following:

  • Any toiletries or liquids that are too large to be carried on (think: lotion, shampoo, medications)
  • Bulky items, like blankets, jackets, or sweaters
  • Items that don’t fit cleanly in a carry-on, like large makeup bags, blow dryers, or shoes (we recommend using The Shoe Cube for those)

Use a Family Checklist

Use a family list so everyone has what they need. Before you leave, run through the list and have each family member locate it to ensure it got packed. This helps avoid fights over who gets the one charger you packed or late-night stops to get a forgotten toothbrush. The extra five minutes it takes to double-check the bag against the list can significantly decrease the strain on the vacation because no one wants to go to the supermarket to pick up soap or extra clothes right after landing.

Simplify Outfits With “Kid Fits”

One way to make sure each kid has a full outfit for every day is to create what we refer to as “kid fits.” These methods ensure that each day has underwear, bottoms, socks, and shirts without tons of searching through bags. There is a method behind the madness, so pick the packing method that works best for you.

Roll-and-Cube

If you prefer to organize by clothing type, roll the clothing up in different colored cubes for products. For example, use The Insider Packing Cubes in red for socks, while the orange can be used for shirts. Let your kids pick the colors so it’s easy to remember (and more fun to pack and unpack). 

Daily Outfit

Use our Kids Packing Cubes to roll up an entire outfit. Include everything your kids need for each day. They can grab a bag and get dressed without your help and without destroying your suitcase.

Kids Choice

Older kids have a bit more autonomy when it comes to packing. One way to empower them to pack and organize is to create a list of items each child needs. Your list may look something like this:

  • Shirts - 1-2 per day of your trip
  • Pants/shorts - fewer than tops
  • 1 jacket
  • Socks - 1-2 pairs per day
  • Underwear - 1 pair per day, plus a few extras
  • Charger
  • Toothbrush

Packing Pro Level Activated

Here are a couple of extra things to add to make you feel like a pro whenever you vacation:

  • Use the drawstring laundry bag for dirty laundry, wet swimsuits, or damp towels.
  • Use The Small Toiletry Bag to include emergency items like pain relievers, band-aids, and necessary medications.
  • Always check for chargers and make sure batteries are fully charged before you leave because nothing is more painful than a 2-year-old with a dead iPad on a flight.
  • If you think you’ve packed enough snacks for the plane, double it.
  • Outfit insurance is free but necessary, so make sure you add one extra outfit to account for accidents, spills, and unexpected weather.

At Away, we know that travel is best when it’s convenient. Make your family travel easier with our perfectly paired kids bundles. Take the guesswork out of packing for your busy family and bundle The Kids Carry-On, Kids Packing Cubes, and Kids Backpack together. Browse our site to find out how we make travel easy and fun. We believe in our products and are confident you will, too.

entry.title: Stress-Free Business Trip Packing: How to Pack Like a Pro for Work Travel
entry.summary:
Streamline your business travel. Discover Away’s business travel packing list and the best tips to pack efficiently, avoid overpacking, and breeze through any work trip.

More
entry.content:
From in-person meetings to business dinners and industry conventions, corporate travel helps foster the professional spirit and bring the global community together. Fulfilling? You bet. Stressful? Only if you’re not prepared. We know that work trips are mandatory, but your luggage is a choice. From boarding zones to boardrooms, we have luggage bags and accessories that work overtime so you don't have to.

At Away, we want to bring smart, streamlined travel to your business calendar. That’s why our award-winning luggage, bags, and accessories are designed to keep you organized and on track, so you can find what you need—and rock your event in wrinkle-free business attire.

We also believe that work travel can be more. Sometimes traveling for business can turn into traveling for pleasure, and corporate trips become the perfect opportunity to fit in some jet-setting adventures, with different ways to see the world and experience its diverse charms. There’s nothing better than a business trip to Paris that leaves time to explore the Eiffel Tower, a charming bistro, or famous artwork in the Louvre.

Your business adventure is fast approaching, so it’s time for business travel tips for beginners and anyone else looking for Away's travel-tested hacks. We've got you.

Business Travel Packing 101

Even for the most seasoned adventurers, business travel can present a whole new set of challenges. You’ll need to make sure that you’re ready for work no matter where it takes you; prepare for your work trip and take on that conference, client visit, or on-site meeting worry-free. 

Before you start packing, put clothing, accessories, toiletries, tech, and documents into different piles. This makes it easier to see what you’re working with. Next, separate your clothing into casual outfits and business attire. 

If you're wondering how to pack a suit so it won’t get all wrinkled during transit, we've got you covered. We’ve learned from experience that there are many right and wrong ways to pack a suit. Waking up late for a morning meeting in London only to find out your suit is a mess? Once was enough, thanks. That’s why we created the Garment Bag. This protective bag has a full zipper down the front, so there’s no need to stuff a pressed suit inside and hope it comes out looking pretty. Use the tiered loops to keep your suit jacket from folding, and then attach the bag to your favorite Away luggage. The built-in metal hook makes hanging a breeze at your hotel. 

Once your suit is secure in a garment bag, you can organize additional items in your suitcase with The Insider Packing Cubes. The full-zipper opening and mesh top panel make it easy to grab what you need, and you can keep casual and business wear separate. It’s perfect for delicate fabrics prone to snags or wrinkles—like dress shirts and other business attire. 

Pack Like a Pro

If you opt out of a garment bag, no worries, you can still stash it in your carry-on wrinkle free. Here’s the best way to pack a suit in your carry-on: Start with the jacket and lay it face down. Fold the right shoulder back and turn the left shoulder inside out. Carefully slip the folded half into the pocket created by the left shoulder. Then, you’ll fold the jacket horizontally, so the top meets the bottom. 

Dress pants and skirts can also wrinkle, so it’s best to fold and roll. Grab the pant leg opening and lift until it meets the knee. Fold. Then, fold the top half of the pants down over this section and roll lengthwise. Adding tissue paper between the layers can help act as a protective cushion as well. Here are a few more of our favorite pro tips:

  • Packing organizers are great for keeping items organized and easy to access, and they work for everything from clothes to jewelry to toiletries. Accessorize in style with our Hanging Jewelry Organizer, which does the work of storing your favorite pieces and keeping them tangle-free. 

  • The Small Toiletry Bag has all the storage you need and all the easy-clean surfaces you could hope for. Spilled a bit of powder? No problem. It’s as easy as 1-2-3: wipe and get on with your day. If you've ever thrown shoes in a bag and discovered the bag ripped during travel, we have good news: The Shoe Cube keeps outside dirt contained and away from your favorite formal wear. It even comes with a handle for easy transport. You're welcome.

  • Don’t put your business clothes at the bottom of your luggage because wrinkles are bound to result. Set them aside in a packing cube or garment bag and place on top of the other items.  

Creating Your Business Travel Packing List

Luggage is like your home away from home. It’s a place to store your travel must-haves and favorite pieces, but what happens if you don’t bring the right things? Instead of digging through your suitcase for those lucky socks you swear you packed (but never find), make it easy on yourself. Set the stage for business travel success with a packing list sure to become your very own executive assistant.

Here’s what to bring for your next corporate trip, complete with casual wear for when that all-day event ends early or if your business travels fall over a weekend. From wandering through Stockholm’s Gamla Stan city center to savoring the best Parisian cuisine, there’s no shame in squeezing a little ‘you-time’ into your work trip..

Business travel with perks, here we come. Don't forget to tailor the list to your destination.

Clothing

  • Suit jackets and blazers 
  • Dress shirts/blouses
  • Skirts/dress pants
  • Intimates
  • Socks
  • Ties
  • Formal shoes/flats/heels
  • Casual footwear or sneakers
  • Casual t-shirts/long-sleeve shirts and pants/shorts
  • Pajamas
  • Jacket
  • Cardigan or sweater
  • Workout clothes
  • Accessories 
  • Sunglasses
  • Handbag or wallet
  • Belt
  • Sun hat
  • Warm hat and gloves
  • Travel first aid kit
  • Mini sewing kit
  • Snacks
  • Reusable water bottle
  • Watch or jewelry
  • Umbrella

Toiletries

  • Travel-size shampoo and conditioner
  • Styling products
  • Deodorant
  • Makeup
  • Lotion
  • Mouth wash
  • Toothpaste and toothbrush
  • Tissues
  • Sunscreen
  • Bug spray
  • Glasses or contacts
  • Contact lens solution
  • Lip balm
  • Razor and shaving cream
  • Face wash or wipes
  • Menstrual products
  • Prescription medications

Travel Documents and Tech

  • Credit cards and cash in local currency
  • Cell phone
  • Mobile Wi-Fi hotspot
  • Book or eBook tablet
  • Laptop
  • Charge cords and power adapters
  • Passport and approved travel visas
  • Business cards
  • Headphones
  • Small notebook and pen


Did Someone Say New Luggage? 

The right luggage is essential for work travel that’s optimized and efficient. Tangled tech cords? Broken zippers? Not when you travel with Away. Our extensive collection of high-quality suitcases gives you the perfect foundation for organized travel and streamlined adventures.

If you love the look of traditional luggage, consider The Carry-On, which fits into major airline overhead bins and comes in both hardside and Softside styles. This fan-favorite piece has TSA-approved locks, plenty of mesh and zippered pockets, and 360° spinner wheels for effortless travel that avoids the hassle of checking a bag. Plus, it lets you breeze past baggage claim on your way to important meetings, and is compact enough to stash somewhere until you get to your hotel.

Suitcases should also protect what matters most. That’s why our hardside luggage features a durable polycarbonate shell, and each Softside is wrapped in a water-repellant soft exterior. What about protecting your souvenirs, though? We hear you. Zipper expansion and our patented compression system leave more room for those spontaneous purchases—because every trip deserves fun mementos.

For pared-down work trips, we know convenience is key, which is why we made The Softside Compact Carry-On. This compact version of our best-selling Carry-On is the ultimate solution for quick trips, commuters, and light packers alike. No need to haul around a larger suitcase for just a few outfits! With The Softside Compact Carry-On, you can fit all of your business-travel essentials without the headache of an oversized suitcase. Plus, your suitcase slips into all major airline bins with room to spare. If you prefer, you can even slip your Carry-On under the seat ahead of you on some major airlines. Grab-and-go travel couldn’t be easier.  

Our Garment Duffle also has a magic trick: It’s one bag for many purposes. Place your pressed suit in the built-in garment bag, and use the main compartment for packing cubes and other organizers. You’ll also find expanding shoe pockets that keep footwear away from clean clothes. This dual wonder even has a laptop sleeve for your device and plenty of zippered pockets for keeping smaller items organized. 

Business Trips Made Easy

The next time you're headed to a business meeting in New York or a conference in Vegas, you'll have all the tools to pack what you need, fold like a pro, and keep your business wear looking fresh. To start your trip off right, browse our collection of high-quality luggage, bags, and travel must-haves for a travel uniform designed to look good and work with you. There's nothing better than a perfectly organized suitcase to set you up for business success because you should have a bag that works as hard as you do.

entry.title: How to Customize Your Travel Uniform with Matching Luggage + Personalized Luggage Tags
entry.summary:
Travel in style with matching luggage and personalized luggage tags from Away. Choose duffles, suitcases, carry-ons, totes, and more to create your ideal coordinated travel set.

More
entry.content:
Who wants to spend their precious vacation time playing spot-the-suitcase at baggage claim? We certainly don't. At Away, we think your bags should stand out and make a statement so that you can easily spot your luggage, grab it, and be on your way.  

We call this your "travel uniform," and, no, we aren't exactly talking about your airplane fits. All of our suitcases and bags are designed to work together, and when you find the perfect matching set — you've found your travel uniform. Having a matching luggage set not only makes you look *really* put-together but also helps make the whole experience fuss-free.

Here are some valuable tips for coordinating a fashionable and functional travel uniform, plus some valuable travel hacks to avoid losing your luggage. With matching pieces, a personalized tag, and standout accessories, you'll be ready to take on the world — and look good doing it.

Prep your travel uniform 

A matching set of high-quality luggage can do a lot for your psyche. It'll have you feeling more organized and confident, no matter how stressful your itinerary is. Away's line of customizable suitcases, duffle bags, backpacks, and crossbody bags make it easy to assemble a stylish travel set with thoughtful details like trolley sleeves and matching colors. Just slip your bag onto your suitcase's luggage handles and move effortlessly through the terminal with one hand free to sip your coffee, hold your ticket, or check your phone. 

For checked suitcases, choose from an array of classic colors or stand-out hues — like Sorbet Orange, Salt White, or Tango Red — and match them with a luggage tag and carry-on sling bag or backpack so you've got one hand free for your iced latte.

Going on a long trip? Bundle a big, durable checked bag like The Large Flex with a functional personal item like The Everywhere Bag for a seamless set that will get you from point A to point B like a chic influencer. Headed for an outdoorsy excursion? Pair the Active Convertible Backpack 25L with the Active Rolling Duffle 85L for a comfortable way to effortlessly carry your things up the steep steps of your hillside lodge.

Regardless of your destination or itinerary, we have plenty of suitcase and bag combos to get you there with ease (and looking your best).

Let your bag stand out as much as you do

Stop playing Where in the World Is Carmen San DiLuggage. Make it easy to get in and out of baggage claim with a matching luggage set that makes a statement. Here are our favorite travel tips to make those long-haul days effortless: 

  • Choose a contrasting color for your luggage tag. If you have a very popular bag color (we're looking at you, Jet Black and Navy Blue suitcase owners!), we recommend adding a soft pop of color. A bag like The Medium Flex in Jet Black is one-of-a-kind when you pair it with the The Luggage Tag in Sorbet Orange.
  • Add an eye-catching accessory. We love the idea of tying a bright scarf to a handle or attaching an easy-to-spot Micro Everywhere Bag charm to your bag to make it even more personalized.
  • Mix and match with unique colors: Show your true colors with chic hues like Clay Pink or Sea Green. An eye-catching green luggage tag or a Featherlight Crossbody in Arctic Blue or Amaro Brown can cultivate a unique look.

 

That's my purse! Why you need a personalized luggage tag

A personalized Luggage Tag can help you easily spot your bag in transit and be the key to getting your bags back ASAP in case you get struck by the dreaded lost bag curse. First step: Personalize your luggage tag with a coordinated color and your stamped initials. Choose the personalization option when adding your item — whether it's a bag or a tag — to your cart. You can pick from multiple colors, styles, and placements.

For your luggage tag, make sure to update the card inside with your basic info. Use a non-smudging pen or pencil to add your:

  • Full name
  • Permanent address
  • Email
  • Phone number

If you really want your luggage tag to do the heavy lifting, you can include the best way for someone to reach you while you're away from home. This can help a lost luggage department get your bags to you in a speedier manner.

How to keep your bags from disappearing

Sometimes you just need to check a bag. We get it. Here are some proactive ways to make sure your bags make it to your final destination. 

  • Double-check your baggage tags. Once you've attached your Away luggage tag to your checked bags, check that your airline put the right tags on your luggage and that it's not falling off your handle anytime soon. Right destination? Check. Securely fastened? Double-check. Now, stash that receipt in your crossbody bag so it doesn't get lost in transit.
  • Can't fly direct? Give yourself enough time between connections. Flying direct is typically preferable, and it's harder for your bags to get lost in transit. Of course, that's not always possible. When choosing a connection, try to pick a flight that gives you some wiggle room in the case of a delayed first leg. This will allow enough time for you and your luggage to arrive together.
  • Be early. No matter what your method of transportation is, it's always a good idea to arrive early so that you can comfortably check your bags in or safely stow them.

Also — just in case your checked bags don't make it as quickly to your destination as you do — don't forget to pack all essentials and valuables in your personal item or carry-on luggage. If you opt not to check a bag, store all your must-haves in the Softside Carry-On. Deceptively capacious, it has ample room for up to seven outfits, plus important items like electronics, travel documents, medications, and intimates. 

Match it with The Everywhere Bag for a strategic pack. The perfect addition to a rolling suitcase, this bag features a handy trolley sleeve and multi-functional pockets. Plus, it meets airline requirements as a personal item, so you can always keep an eye on your most essential things.

Finding your Everywhere Bag everywhere you go

Away luggage is not only functional but designed to make your travels feel more special. Choose from sleek nylon fabric bags and durable suitcases that can withstand even the roughest trips and most ... erm, enthusiastic baggage handlers. With our unique colors and designs, you can customize your travel uniform to include everything you need for a smooth and stylish trip. 

Mix and match your checked bags, carry-ons, and luggage tags to help you easily spot your luggage no matter how hectic the airport or mode of transportation you end up on. Find the look and functionality that's best for you and that allows you (and your matching luggage set) to stand out from the crowd.

Your travel uniform awaits — and so does your next destination.

entry.title: The Ultimate Away Travel Gift Guide
entry.summary:
Searching for holiday gifts for travelers is a breeze with Away’s travel gift ideas—from big suitcases to the accessories they didn't know they needed.

More
entry.content:
If you're a travel enthusiast or know someone who is, you can't wait to head out and explore the world. At Away, we believe the more we travel, the better we all become. That’s why our travel essentials are designed to last (and last) for every trip to come, so you can get out there and explore. 

For the loved ones who always seem to be planning their next adventure or love being (extra) organized, look no further than Away this gift-giving season. Away products are designed for travelers who refuse to be defined. From our Everywhere Bag to our Active Rolling Duffle and Quilted Everywhere Backpack, we have luggage pieces that suit any need and are the perfect travel gifts. This is your ultimate gift guide to finding and giving the best holiday gifts for travelers in your life. 

Travel gift guide: Creating the goodie bag

Here's how to create a holiday travel goodie bag with Christmas gifts for travelers.

1. Pick the main feature 

The central piece should be the big luggage for all those clothes, devices, toiletries, and other gear. Need some travel gift ideas? 

Carry-Ons: The Carry-On or Bigger Carry-On

Away's award-winning Carry-On and Bigger Carry-On are the ultimate choice for the jet-setter ready to see the sights. Durable, smooth rolling—check out those 360 wheels—and full of inner compartments and compression, our Carry-Ons let you pack like a maximalist while traveling like a minimalist. Most importantly, the Carry-On fits most domestic and international airline overhead bins, and our Bigger Carry-On works for most major U.S. airlines. They're the perfect gift for travelers who love to get up and go with no checked pieces holding them back.

You can also create a travel uniform with matching or mix-and-match suitcases and bags. As a dynamic duo, the full travel uniform pairs pieces for flexible travel and all the organization your loved one needs. Carry-on luggage sets are another gift any traveler would love. Plus, you'll love the savings! Available in sets of two or three, Away suitcase sets keep travel effortless with versatile pieces and enough room for clothing, devices, and other essentials—wherever you travel.

Checked luggage: The Medium, The Large, or The Trunk

If you're shopping for someone who can't bear leaving home without those creature comforts, you might find checked luggage is a better gift choice. Consider Away's Medium, Large, or Trunk luggage. Each suitcase provides room for one to two weeks of travel—sometimes even two or three weeks for our Large and Trunk suitcases. They all feature our signature compression system, plenty of grab handles, and traveler-approved 360 wheels, and are available in both water-resistant hardshell and Softside options. 

Whether traveling for business or pure adventure, there's more than enough room for outfit changes, souvenirs, or whatever else brings them joy—portable coffee machine, anyone?

Duffle: The Outdoor Duffle 55L, The Outdoor Duffle 70L, or The Outdoor Rolling Duffle 85L

Sometimes, adventurers want to keep things casual. The Outdoor Collection includes The Active Duffle 55L and The Active Duffle 70L, perfect for travelers who crave the simple life. These duffles have lightweight but hard-wearing and water-resistant polyester designed for spontaneous trips to the mountains, the desert, and everywhere in between. Looking for versatility? Detach the straps and reattach them in the top-facing slots. Instant backpack! Now that's a travel gift worth giving.

What if your loved one has a different approach to outdoor travel? Consider The Active Rolling Duffle 85L, which gives more room and has handy wheels, a trolley handle, and four grab handles for hassle-free hauling. The hardside base protects against rugged rides from the Australian Outback to Marrakech, while the inner proprietary Flipfold Frame makes packing easier than finding your passport. 

2. Travel bags are the perfect addition to any travel gift

Next up: those portable side pieces that let you see and touch the world as you travel.

Backpack: The Transit Leather Backpack, Featherlight Backpack, or Everywhere Zip Backpack

City-bound? Countryside adventure? There's a backpack for that. Our Transit Leather Backpack has a high-quality DriTan™ leather and canvas exterior, sleek design, and wraparound zipper. Along with comfy straps and all the storage pockets we could pack in, this backpack will become your BFF on the road. 

For lightweight travel, look no further than our Featherlight Backpack. It has the inner compartments of your dreams—plus a laptop pocket and extra-durable straps. Our Everywhere Zip Backpack is another fan favorite, with a water-resistant exterior, storage compartments galore, and a full wraparound zipper. Whoever said backpacks are just for students? These travel pieces bring a newfound freedom to your adventures.

Crossbody: Featherlight Sling Bag or Large Featherlight Crossbody

When you're checking out the city sights, it pays to travel light but roomy. Enter Away's Featherlight Sling Bag and Large Featherlight Crossbody. Leave the big suitcase at your hotel and slip on a comfy crossbody bag. Voila! Sightseeing made easy. 

With water-resistant construction, inner compartments, and adjustable straps, crossbodies store everything fromto phones and sunglasses. Our Large Featherlight is also big enough for a water bottle, favorite device, or travel journal. The perfect Crossbody gifts let jet-setters explore everything from narrow back streets to busy squares with all the essentials in tow. 

3. Travel accessories make the perfect stocking stuffers

You can make your gift even more fun with stocking stuffer goodies. 

Accessories? Yes, please

Whether getting ready for desert adventures or mountain ascents, your loved one might appreciate a place to store their footwear. Our Shoe Cube is just the thing to keep trail-worn shoes separate from the rest of their gear. Another handy accessory is our Circle Zip Pouch for storing credit cards or some Japanese yen bills—or maybe Euros? Turkish liras? Norwegian kroner? 

Need more travel gifts? Consider the Micro Everywhere Bag. It's small but mighty—perfect for lip balm, cards, earbuds, and other must-haves. For the traveler who loves to stay organized, Away's Insider Packing Cube Set gives them more room than they thought possible—thanks to the nylon construction that works with our compression straps. 

Show off your style with personalized luggage tags

Luggage Tags help identify your stuff, especially when you opt to personalize them. Away's personalization tool lets you add up to three letters to stamp onto your tag. We're all about those real-world adventures.

Did you know? Away also offers personalization for suitcases, totes, backpacks, and other Away products. Hardshell luggage features printed personalization, while fabric products have embroidered detailing. Customizing their gift brings a special touch and also helps make baggage claim a breeze! 

New luggage is the best holiday gift

Your suitcase travels with you on each adventure, which means one unavoidable truth: wear and tear. Luggage takes a beating over time, so it's always nice to replenish the supply—and it's always fun to give and get! Luggage is already a reflection of its owner's style, but with personalization options, you can turn a new travel bag into a one-of-a-kind gift. 

Luggage is more than a place to keep your stuff. It's your home away from home, which means accessories and storage compartments that keep everything within reach are crucial. A practical gift to keep a traveler organized says both, "I got you" and "Here's a gift you won't have to return."

Let's add a gift card or a self-gift

Maybe your loved one likes to pick their own gift. We've all been there. If so, they'll find much to love with an Away Gift Card you can customize with heartfelt messaging. Our digital cards extend the joy of gifting and let them choose the perfect travel piece.

Have your gift purchases led to a wish list of your own? We've been there too! If you've found travel pieces that speak to you, maybe it's time to indulge in a bit of self-gifting. Hard-wearing, long-lasting, and functional pieces are always in style and can bring the perfect opportunity to get out and travel.

Holiday gifts they can't wait to use

When selecting travel gifts, the pieces you choose should be as unique as the person getting them. The perfect travel gifts should be a blend of high quality and functional. Money well spent? We think so, too. 

Away means long-lasting quality and thoughtful style that's sure to become your—or anyone's—constant travel companion. Let's get gifting and exploring.

entry.title: Diaper Bag Buying Guide: How to Choose a Diaper Bag
entry.summary:
Searching for the best diaper bag for you and baby? Discover how to choose the perfect diaper bag that fits your families style, only at Away.

entry.content:
Diaper bags: They're the best support system for parents on the go. These travel companions are there for you whether you’re catching the sun on Bali’s Padang Padang Beach or enjoying your neighborhood park—and they do it all with style.
The best diaper bags keep up with your travels, helping you and baby breeze through each  day. No matter where you and your family are headed on your next adventure, our ultimate diaper bag buying guide will help you get there.


Choosing the Best Diaper Bags for Your Family

Wondering what to look for in a diaper bag? Top features should include flexible compartments, wipeable and easy-to-clean designs, and tons of pockets. We’re all about pockets: big, small, and everything in between. That way, you can slip in those last-minute wet wipes, stuffed animals, and pacifiers and everything else you might need on-the-go. 

When you're traveling, your diaper bag needs to work extra hard to keep you and baby as organized and comfortable as possible. Along with diapers and soft blankets for your little one, functional diaper bags need space for parent essentials like passports, phones, water bottle holder, and your favorite snacks. 

Another top feature in the best diaper bags? High-quality materials that stand up to life’s adventures (and misadventures). You want a bag that doesn’t fail in its duties when messy moments happen. From wipeable liners to rugged zippers and hard-wearing, baby-proof sides, how travel diaper bags are built is as important as how much they can hold. 

A handy compartment that stores dirty items out of sight can be a lifesaver, too. At Away, we know that family travel can be unpredictable and that it’s best to go with the flow. That’s why we created The Double Diaper Backpack and The Double Diaper Tote with a bottom compartment that zips the mess away (at least until you can find a waste bin). Parents everywhere, you’re welcome. 


The Absolute Must-Have Features of Diaper Bags

Whether it's a diaper bag tote or backpack, what are the best features inside and out? This is where the fun starts. The best diaper bags come with the following accessories and essentials:

  • Base: Nothing is more frustrating than a diaper bag that keeps falling over. A wide base keeps the bag upright so everything stays organized.
  • Main compartment: Pockets are great, but a roomy main compartment is also important.
  • Material: You want a bag that you can wipe down quickly.
  • Closure mechanism: Don’t fight buttons; look for a zipper or magnet clasp.
  • Bottle pockets: Baby’s going to grow and their bottles will, too, so look for pockets big enough to hold bottles of all sizes.
  • Insulated pockets: Keep sippy cups, water, or breastmilk safe and at the preferred temperature.


The Best Diaper Bag for Travel

There’s a lot to consider when choosing the best type of diaper bag. You want your bag to be functional, but you also want it to look good and suit your travel uniform.

Totes and backpacks are the most common options. Which one you choose comes down to personal preference. Let’s take a minute to review the diaper bag tote vs. backpack debate—and see which one best fits your personality.


1. Diaper Bag Totes 

These bags have a wide zipper opening and expand toward the base for stand-on-their-own usage. If your hands are busy with your little one, you don’t have to worry about the bag tipping over (or that diaper rash cream tumbling down the hill). Large straps make one-shoulder carrying a breeze.

Spotlighting Away's The Double Diaper Tote

Totes are some of the most versatile travel companions. With The Double Diaper Tote, we took our classic totes to new heights with a bag perfect for parents and babies.   

You’ll love these features:

  • 1 large exterior front pocket
  • 2 zippered compartments (one with mesh side pockets, the other with a padded horizontal tech sleeve)
  • D-rings for stroller attachment
  • Trolley sleeve
  • Stroller straps with clips
  • Bottom zippered compartment with wipeable liner
  • 2 exterior zippered, expandable bottle pockets
  • Padded shoulder straps

With a spacious 30L capacity, The Double Diaper Tote holds even more of your travel must-haves. Baby blanket? Check. Stuffed animals? We see you, Mr. Bear. Bulky items fit in with room to spare. We also included a foldable, wipeable changing pad, and zippered carry-all pouch for small creams, diapers, and other essentials–check, check, and check. 


2. Diaper Bag Backpacks 

Backpacks tend to be deep rather than wide, so they’re better suited to urban areas or crowded airports so you can get around easier with less baggage. They also have two padded straps to balance the weight and keep your arms free. 

Spotlighting Away's The Double Diaper Backpack

Who said backpacks were just for school? With The Double Diaper Backpack, you’ll be ready to board the plane (or just do your  errands) with everything baby needs.

You’ll find features like:

  • 2 zippered compartments (one with mesh and clear pockets, the other with a padded vertical tech sleeve)
  • 2 exterior front-facing pockets
  • 2 expandable bottle pockets
  • Bottom zippered compartment for messy items
  • Padded handle and straps
  • D-rings and a trolley sleeve
  • Stroller straps with clips

The Double Diaper Backpack has a spacious 23L holding capacity, giving plenty of room for your travel essentials. The best-quality diaper bags are full of pockets to keep parents organized, but we went even further by including accessories like a changing pad and carry-all pouch. It’s streamlined travel that fits the modern world. 


Diaper Bags + Travel: Happy Baby, Happy You

So which one makes the best diaper bag for travel? If you like timeless styles that give you versatility, organization, and easy access, choose a tote. If you have an active lifestyle and favor pouch-style organization and freedom of movement, go for a backpack. 

Either way, you’ll love how the best travel diaper bag gives you room for baby essentials while keeping your travels on track.


Diaper Bag Accessories To Elevate Your Travel

You’ve got your eye on a stylish, good-quality diaper bag full of pockets, inner compartments, and wipe-and-go fabric. Now you’re on the hunt for accessories to take it to the next level. 

Some of the best diaper bag accessories focus on organization. With a little one in tow, you don't want to spend all of your time rummaging. Whether you're taking a shopping trip through Paris’ Champs-Élysées or just heading to the grocery store around the corner, Away’s diaper bags come with functional accessories to help you find what you need when you need it. 

Start With Diaper Bag Organizers

Topping the list are diaper bag organizing pouches. They’re like mini goodie bags. They give you a burst of happiness upon opening (extra onesie or pacifier, there you are!), and they’re easy to collect and store. 

Many parents discover that organizers become their travel-with-baby BFF— Keep all of your essentials at your fingertips with a convenient carry-all pouch, available in both The Double Diaper Tote and The Double Diaper Backpack. Designed to fit seamlessly, it holds a handful of diapers, wipes, and creams, making on-the-go changes effortless and organized.

These organizing pouches are even perfect for you. Slip in your sunglasses, phone charger, and snacks, and never look back. At last, no more digging around to find that rogue parent essential.

Add a Changing Pad

Accessories can be as simple as having a clean place for your baby during diaper changes. A diaper changing pad is essential on travels because you never know where you’ll be when a whoopsie happens. On the road between Milan and Turin? Getting off the train at Tokyo’s Shinjuku Station? With a diaper bag and changing pad, you’re all set to do a quick diaper change and get on with your day.  

Make on-the-go diaper changes a breeze with our foldable, wipeable changing pad. Thoughtfully designed to fit perfectly in your Away diaper bag, you'll always be ready no matter where your little one takes you.

Finish With Other Extras 

Other popular accessories include stroller clips, an insulated bottle case, and even bag charms. The last are more functional than you think. Not only do bag charms add a fun pop of color, but they help you identify your bag from a distance. Are we speaking from experience? You bet. Grabbing the wrong diaper bag is a travel faux pas no parent wants to repeat. 

Now that you've got your accessories lined up, are you wondering what to pack in diaper bags? Read on for handy tips. 


Let’s Talk Essentials: The Diaper Bag Checklist 

What goes in a diaper bag depends on where you’re going and how long you’ll be away. Whether it’s a short morning journey or an all-day adventure, don’t skimp on these diaper bag essentials:

  • Diapers (one to two for every two hours you’ll be out)
  • Pack of wipes and diaper rash cream
  • Hand sanitizer
  • Burp cloths
  • Extra outfit (two if possible)
  • Extra socks (two pairs)
  • Soft blanket
  • Stuffed animal friends or toys
  • Bottles and enough formula or milk
  • Nursing cover
  • Pacifiers (in a resealable bag)
  • Waste bags (compostable if possible)
  • Baby food, snacks, and water
  • Sippy cups and bib
  • Bandages and first-aid cream

Plus, don't forget about essentials for traveling parents:

  • Phone
  • Charger
  • Adult snacks and protein bars
  • Extra shirt
  • Sunglasses
  • Wallet
  • Keys

Adjust the baby essentials by season. For example, summer hats and sunscreen keep your baby safe from sunburns, while wooly hats and gloves add warmth when it’s cool (or you’re out later than expected). Once you know what to put in a diaper bag and have it packed away, you can focus on all of the fun memories you’ll make together.  


How To Pack a Diaper Bag for Travel

You have the accessories. You’ve checked (and double-checked) the list. Now it's time to figure out how to pack a diaper bag.

Start with function. Diapers, wipes, and rash cream should be stored together. So should baby formula, bottles, and burp cloths. It’s also a good idea to put the same items in the same compartments each time you travel. This way, you're always one step ahead.

Put the most-used items in side pockets and compartments, while other essentials can go into handy organizers. 

What about how to organize a diaper bag's cozy comforts? From blankets to stuffed animals to extra outfits, these essentials tend to take up more room—but you should never go without them.

Away’s The Insider Packing Cubes or Pouch Duo gives you the ultimate organization for bulkier items. We know how important versatile packing is, which is why all of our organizers feature wipeable surfaces and full zippers. From baby essentials to storage for kids on the move, these long-lasting organizers go wherever your family does.


Away Has Your Family Covered

Away’s diaper bags feature durable materials, functional designs, and the versatility you need. From The Double Diaper Tote bag to The Double Diaper Backpack, Away has you and your family covered. 

Our diaper bags also work with our other products, giving you a seamless travel uniform wherever the world—or your errands—will take you. Our diaper bag backpacks and totes even have handy trolley sleeves to fit on all of Away's award-winning suitcases. 

Instead of wondering how to choose a diaper bag or how to pack a diaper bag for travel, you’ll soon be saying, “Where to next?” With Away by your side, it's time to head out on those memorable family outings and vacations.

entry.title: Winter Travel Guide: Ski Destinations & Packing Tips

Discover the best places to travel in winter with our ski trip guide and get winter travel packing tips for your next snowy adventure.

More
entry.content:
Best Destinations to travel this winter? We’ve got you.

Dreaming of fresh powder and breathtaking peaks? Whether you’re planning your next ski trip to Breckenridge, Park City, or Stowe, or beyond, we’ve got winter travel tips to make it seamless. From packing advice to choosing the best destinations, let this guide inspire your next adventure. Let's dive in...

 

Breckenridge, Colorado & Ski Resort

Breckenridge, Colorado, is a must-visit for any winter travel itinerary. Known for its “High Five,” Breckenridge Ski Resort spans five peaks, offering 35 lifts and 187 trails. If you’re a beginner, there’s approximately 10% of the mountain you can practice on, while expert trails cover about 35% of the mountain. 

With nearly 3,000 acres of skiable terrain and close to 400 inches of snowfall each year, Breckenridge is one of the best places to travel in winter. Almost 3,000 acres in area, Breckenridge gets close to 400 inches of snowfall each year. Enroll the kids in private lessons and enjoy a guided tour of the mountain, or explore the charming resort shops between runs. Satisfy the shopping urge at one of the many resort shops. Or set out on a 3-day trip to explore the entire mountain with Breck staff to guide you.

 

Ski Resorts in Stowe, Vermont

For East Coast skiers, Stowe, Vermont, ski resorts are the ultimate winter getaway. At Stowe Mountain Resort, Vermont’s highest peak, you’ll find 116 trails, 12 lifts, and an average of 314 inches of snowfall. This mountain has solid beginner options on 16% of the mountain. If you want to push the envelope, almost one-third of the terrain is for advanced skiers and snowboarders.

Whether it’s your best friend’s bachelor party or a family-friendly trip, Stowe, Vermont, ski resorts offer lessons for beginners and additional adventures to challenge the daredevils. 

 

Skiing at Park City Mountain Resort

Utah’s claim to “the best snow on earth” rings true, especially when skiing at Park City Mountain Resort. Located in Park City, Utah, this destination boasts 330 trails, 40 lifts, and over 7,300 acres of skiable terrain—making it a winter travel favorite.

Park City is second to none when it comes to a memorable winter experience. There’s shopping downtown, specialized candy shops, and a long season to enjoy every last snowflake. Fly into Salt Lake City and your destination is a short 45 minutes away, with cozy lodges and terrain for every level.

 

Winter Ski Trip Packing Guide

You’ve picked a place to go for your snow skiing trip and booked your tickets; now the next step is packing. At Away, we’ve designed products to hold everything you need for the perfect ski vacation. 

 

What To Bring on a Ski Trip

Figuring out what to pack for a ski trip might seem intimidating--luckily, we've got a winter travel packing list of the most important items to bring:

  • Ski clothing: Pants, jacket, gloves, thermal underwear, light pullover, ski socks, sunglasses
  • Ski equipment: Goggles, helmet, sunscreen (a necessity, believe it or not), hat, water bottle
  • Off-slope clothing: Waterproof winter jacket, snow boots
  • Snowboard or ski gear: Skis or snowboard with bindings, boots, and poles

While the slopes can get warm as you work up a sweat, downtown areas might be brisk. Pack for layering and don’t forget a swimsuit for relaxing in a hot tub or heated pool after a day on the mountain.


How to Pack for Winter Travel

Packing for a ski trip doesn’t have to be complicated—but, we’ll admit, skis and snowboards aren’t exactly carry-on friendly. For convenience, we recommend travel products designed to handle the outdoors, like our Carry-On Boot Bag 55L, which keeps ski equipment organized while doubling as a compact carry-on.

If you're planning a trip with minimal luggage, here’s everything you need to know to pack light and smart—without sacrificing the essentials.

Winter Travel with Only a Carry-On

Traveling with just a carry-on isn’t just possible; it’s packed with perks:

  • Skip the Lines: Say goodbye to check-in counters and baggage claim for a smoother airport experience.
  • Avoid Extra Costs: Save on checked bag fees and dodge the stress of lost luggage.
  • Travel Light: Keep things simple while still bringing everything you need.

If you plan to rent ski equipment at your destination, packing all your winter clothes in a carry-on is a great way to streamline your trip.

 

Smart Packing Tips for Ski Trips 

The key to packing light is to get strategic:

  • Wear Your Bulky Items: Travel in your coat, boots, and layers to save carry-on space. Once on the plane, you can shed layers and store them under the seat, in your personal item, or in the overhead bin.
  • Choose Versatile Pieces: Pack thermals, ski pants, and mid-layers that you can rewear. For a long trip, plan to use laundry services.
  • Maximize Your Personal Item: Use a medium backpack to hold toiletries, electronics, gloves, and even smaller gear like goggles or hand warmers.


Our Top Travel Solutions for Winter Trips

1. Carry-On Boot Bag 55L
This water-resistant bag is designed to carry your boots, helmet, goggles, and up to two days’ worth of clothes. It fits most carry-on size requirements and pairs perfectly with a small personal item for extra packing space. Ideal for short trips or when traveling light.

2. Active Rolling Duffle 85L
Need to bring more for a luxurious mountain getaway? This spacious bag is the perfect checked luggage for winter ski trips, accommodating gear, layers, and outfits for evenings at the lodge. Durable and easy to maneuver, it’s the ultimate companion for extended trips.

3. The Hanging Toixletry Bag
Keep accessories and essentials organized and separate from your clothing for tangle-free travel. It’s compact, functional, and made for easy access on the go.

 

Additional Packing Tips for Ski Trips

Whether you're using carry-on luggage or checking a bag, these tips will help you pack efficiently:

  • Roll Your Clothes: Save space and prevent wrinkles.
  • Compress Bulky Items: Use the signature compression system in all of our luggage options to squeeze in those larger items. 
  • Protect Fragile Gear: Pack goggles in their case or tuck them inside your helmet, or padded pocket of the Carry-on Boot Bag 55L.


Winter Travel Essentials

Don’t let packing stress take the fun out of your winter trip. Our Carry-On Boot Bag 55L and Active Rolling Duffle 85L are designed for convenience, durability, and style—helping you hit the slopes or relax fireside with ease.

Explore the full Active Collection today, and gear up for your next snowy adventure.

Your morning commute is your time, whether sitting in traffic or sharing public transit with forty "close" friends. You get to decide how to use it, and stocking your work bag with the right combo of tech, snacks, and entertainment can help get your work day off to the right start.

Choosing the right work bag can really make a difference in your commute. Walking to the office? Opt for something water-resistant that can withstand unexpected weather or an accidental coffee spill. Packing a uniform? Look for a roomier backpack-style bag for more space and extra comfortable straps. 

At Away, we have everything you need to make your commute in style and ultimate comfort. Wherever your needs land in the eternal tote vs. backpack debate, we have the guide to your best bag options for hauling all your odds and ends while still looking chic.  Whether driving yourself or commuting with others, find the best work bag to protect that expensive company laptop and your afternoon snacks. 

The best work bags for commuting

The expandable exterior water bottle pockets stretch to accommodate your largest tumbler — because if a commute is rough, a commute while dehydrated is rougher. Headed off for a work trip? Slip the backpack's trolley sleeve right over the handle of your luggage. The Commuter Backpack is built for the busy professional, no matter how long the commute is today. 

Selecting the perfect work tote

Water-resistant for when you get caught in a rain storm on the walk from the station, this bag securely holds a laptop in its dedicated sleeve. With multi-purpose accessories to use at home or for work, you can leave behind swapping out your belongings for different bags in different settings. You have a single tote that works everywhere.

The Everywhere Tote is the kind of commuter tote that can be perfect for a Sunday brunch or Tuesday commute. With its sleek lines, deceptively roomy interior, and a 15" laptop sleeve, it's ready to transport your goods back and forth to the office (or brunch) with ease. If you're on the hunt for something versatile, The Everywhere Tote is ideal for swapping from personal to professional in a snap.

The commuter's checklist

Whichever style of bag you need to make your commute functional, don't forget to stock it with the essentials, including:

  • Noise-canceling headphones: Whether you're into true-crime podcasts or audiobooks, block out any external noise with some quality noise-canceling headphones safely stashed in your Tech Case. You don't even have to use any audio. Just wear them so no one tries to make small talk. We won't tell!
  • Snacks and water bottle: Ran out the door without breakfast? Check those interior backpack pockets for your emergency granola bar stash. And don't forget that water bottle.
  • Entertainment: One of the most essential parts of a tolerable commute is utilizing that time for something you enjoy. That could be meditation or blasting your hype music, but for some, that means entertainment. Stash a Sudoku booklet and a pencil in your work bag to puzzle out on the bus. Pack your e-reader or portable game player for extra boredom busters.
  • Neck pillow: Need to squeeze in some extra z's? Get cozy with a neck pillow. Easy to stash in travel bags, these supportive foam loops can provide a shocking amount of comfort in a tiny package.
  • Hand sanitizer: The outside world is a petri dish. Come prepared.
  • Umbrella: Don't get caught without it. 
  • Chargers & Cables: On-the-go doesn't mean out-of-touch. Stay powered up and keep chargers all in one place in The Organizational Pouch.  
  • Eyewear: Sunglasses for the walk to work and blue light protection lenses for the office. Or, be that Eagle Scout who always has contact lens solution and case on hand.

Choosing the best work bag

A work bag is about more than just function. It's an extension of your office identity, a tangible statement of professional competency and preparation. 

Away bags make it easy to present this persona in a way that will survive the most grueling of commutes. Our sleek styles hold up to heavy use and give you the high-end look you want to travel with confidence. The added dose of organization they provide helps you mentally prepare for whatever the day holds. 

Check out the Commuter Backpack for a bag designed specifically for your commuting needs. Away's travel backpacks and tote bags offer similar structures in an array of styles and fits. Alternatively, browse the tech organizers to make a bag you already love work-ready. So whether you're hustling through the crowded turnstile or squeezing into the back of Becky from marketing's Prius, you'll be ready for anything.

entry.title: How to Spend a Long Weekend in Galway, Ireland
entry.content:
Author: Gillian Sagansky
Photographer: Gaelle Beri
Lead image: Kylemore Abbey in County Galway. Brought to you by

 

The best places to stay, eat, drink, and have fun in Galway, Ireland—2020’s European Capital of Culture.

Often referred to as the “Cultural Heart of Ireland,” it’s no surprise that Galway was voted the European Capital of Culture this year, making Galway even more of a must-visit destination in Ireland. An esteemed accolade which recognizes a city with cultural richness and diversity, the award was conceived in 1985 by the then Greek Minister of Culture in an effort to highlight regions in Europe with vibrant cultural pulses that were perhaps under-the-radar.

The city will be teeming with events all year long, including a lecture by Margaret Atwood on International Women’s Day, various art installations, and an oyster festival at the end of September. 

Galway is also known for its location along the Wild Atlantic Way, one of the most scenic driving routes you will ever encounter. The epic landscape was a mystical backdrop in films such as Harry Potter, The Princess Bride, and Star Wars. If all of that isn’t enough, its rich cultural heritage, weaving cobblestoned streets, vibrant pub scene, and prominence as a rising culinary destination will be sure to win you over.  

→ Learn more about visiting Ireland. 

For a quiet stay, try Glenlo Abbey Hotel, a 138-acre, five-star manor just outside of Galway city.

Where to Stay in Galway

Glenlo Abbey Hotel Galway

Just two miles from Galway city sits Glenlo Abbey Hotel, a 138-acre, five-star manor that has been hosting guests since it opened in 1740. In the colder months, enjoy high tea by their myriad of fireplaces, and in the warmer ones, peruse the beautifully preserved grounds or play golf on their renowned course. 

The Hardiman

Located smack dab in the buzzing Eyre Square in Galway’s city center, this hotel is a short walk from pubs, museums, restaurants, and bars. Formerly known as the Hotel Meyrick, the Victorian-era structure maintains its traditional charm with a contemporary twist. Start your day in their sun-drenched dining room and end it at one of the lobby bars before heading to their roof deck to enjoy the outside jacuzzi.

Pullman Restaurant sits inside a converted train from the 1920s.

Where to Eat in Galway

Pullman Restaurant

Have you ever wondered what it would be like to dine aboard the Orient Express? Make a dinner reservation at the Pullman Restaurant and put your curiosity to rest. On the grounds of the Glenlo Abbey Hotel, this original Pullman train-turned-fine dining experience is identical to when it was built in 1927. Former passengers include Sir Laurence Olivier and Sir Winston Churchill, the latter of whom used the train privately throughout World War II. In 1974, the train starred in Sidney Lumet’s adaptation of Murder on the Orient Express, starring Lauren Bacall, Sean Connery, and Vanessa Redgrave. One of the most memorable dining experiences you’ll have in Galway, be sure to try the asparagus with chamomile and pineapple weed along with the Castlemine Lamb with tempura kelp.

Aniar

The seafoam-colored Michelin-star restaurant is known for its 16-course tasting menu, featuring delicate and inventive dishes like oysters with arrow grass, carrot, elderflower and hock, and meadowsweet rosehip for dessert. While their menu is constantly changing, their food preparation techniques are not; Chef JP McMahon has built a reputation for his traditional cooking and preservation methods, such as pickling, smoking, curing, and fermenting, for which the restaurant has become well known.

Always wanted to have high tea? Cupán Tae is the place to do it in Galway.
Sip slow and enjoy Cupán Tae's cozy and colorful dining room.
Try their delicious breakfasts and lunches alongside unique strains of tea, such as truffle or popcorn caramel candy.

Cupán Tae

This cozy, internationally-acclaimed tea parlor is right out of a fairy tale and a must-visit for lunch or high tea. They pride themselves on their mouth-watering homemade scones baked each morning, tea sandwiches, buttermilk pancakes, and fresh soups. The experience is accompanied by an extensive and uniquely flavored tea offering (truffle tea anyone?), all served on elaborate and colorful china sets.

Loam

With its sparse open kitchen, carefully crafted courses, and raw wood interior, it’s no wonder this design standout was voted the ‘Best Restaurant in Ireland’ last year. Using exclusively local fare, the prix-fixe menu makes use of seasonal ingredients unique to Ireland, all paired with a curated list of biodynamic wines. If you still have room after the burnt honey, whiskey, and raspberry dessert, make sure to order their cheese course. While Loam is known for its meat dishes, they also offer a vegan/vegetarian tasting, which you can secure by calling ahead.

Situated in Salt Hill, Oslo is Galway's only microbrewery.
Every pint comes fresh: There are nine brews on tap, all of them less than ten days old.

Where to Drink in Galway

Oslo Microbrewery and Bar

Located in Salthill, Ireland’s most sought-after seaside fishing town, you’ll find Oslo, Galway’s only microbrewery. The bar offers nine unique beers on tap, all of which are less than ten days old and brewed right on the premises. Sit by the roaring fireplace and make sure to try their Bay Ale and Stormy Porter. If you’re in need of a bite, their hearty lentil soup will do the trick, and be sure to challenge your date to a game of pool in the back billiards room.

Tigh Neachtain

Tigh Neachtain is one of Galway’s most beloved pubs for locals and tourists alike. You’ll feel utterly transported as you weave through a wooden, cavernous labyrinth of cozy side rooms and cubby holes. Coat your stomach with the pub’s famous clam chowder while having a friendly chat with the bartenders. Make sure to peruse the stack of books and magazines on offer and cozy up by one of their fireplaces to enjoy the live music.

Sheridan's is the largest cheese shop in Galway.
Stop in to sample dozens of cheeses, then head next door for a bit of wine to top it all off.

Sheridan’s Wine Bar & Cheese Shop

Tucked away above Sheridan’s Cheese Shop (the largest cheese shop in Galway) sits their quaint wooden paneled wine bar. Their wines by the glass rotate daily, which is reason enough to visit more than once during your trip. Stop by for an afternoon or early evening aperitivo, grab a spot by the window, and take in the views of St. Nicholas Square while enjoying their famous cheese plate, a curated selection of both Irish and imported delicacies. 

Black Cat

Occupying the ground floor of an old prairie house in Salthill, you’ll find the neighborhood’s coziest wine, jazz, and tapas bar. The staff will assist you in pairing their selection of local and imported wine with their scrumptious small plates. Meat lovers should order their lamb sliders, and vegetarians can select from their homemade crostini, like artichoke, caramelized onion, cherry tomato, and goat cheese.

Come hungry: Galway Food Tours invites you to sample from the best of the city's restaurants and bars.
Each stop along the food tour will give you a look into Ireland's food culture, whether through local ingredients or Irish specialties.
Along the way, you'll try everything from fresh sushi to bagel and lox.

What to Do in Galway

Galway Food Tours

Founded by a duo of female food enthusiasts, this tour will show you everything you need to know about Galway’s culinary scene. Make sure to arrive famished because you will want to eat it all. Your tour will start in a cozy booth at Tigh Neachtain, where your guide will bring you a Guinness and a bevy of samples of the local cuisine, from sushi to bagel and lox to local cheeses. You will then begin the walking tour, where you will taste the best of Galway. Sample onion-filled pastries at Marmalade Bakery, cleanse your palette with local Irish roasts at Little Lane Coffee, sample moonshine at McCambridge’s of Galway, and conclude your tour at Hazel Mountain Chocolate, a bean-to-bar chocolate store that offers the best hot cocoa you’ll ever try.

Kylemore Abbey was built by one of the wealthiest men in England as a private home in 1867.

Day Trip to Kylemore Abbey

The journey along the Wild Atlantic Way to Kylemore Abbey is as beautiful as the Abbey itself. Make sure to leave time to walk around the picturesque villages and sprawling fields you’ll encounter on the way. Built by one of the wealthiest men in England as a private home in 1867, arriving at the Abbey is like stepping back in time, as the exterior is virtually unchanged. In 1921, a group of nuns bought the mansion and turned it into an elite all-girls boarding school. While it closed in 2010 and was converted into a digitally interactive museum, many of the tour guides attended the school as students and can regale you with stories.

Once a quaint fishing village, Claddagh is now Galway's most expensive neighborhood.

Claddagh Village

Located outside of Galway’s city walls is Claddagh Village. Founded in the nineteenth century, it is one of the oldest fishing villages in Ireland and remains the most untouched and traditional area of Galway. Known for their thatched-roof houses and cozy interiors, the Claddagh area was purposefully destroyed in 1934 after a deadly tuberculosis outbreak. However, a few cottages were rebuilt to keep the tradition alive, such as Katie’s Claddagh Cottage Heritage Shop, an exact replica of a former Claddagh house. Enjoy tea and biscuits as you peruse local crafts such as Gaelic stone carvings, locally mined green marble works, and Celtic goddess carvings. The best way to see this village is by booking through Galway Bay Tours. 

Pálás

This newly built arthouse cinema adds yet another level of culture to Galway. Duck in during a rainy day (rest assured, you will have one) and have your choice of three films in the concrete “tower house” located in the city’s Latin Quarter. Despite its austere design and concrete exterior, each theater offers plush chairs and elaborate red velvet drapery from floor to ceiling. The project, which took fourteen years to complete, also offers a contemporary eatery and lobby bar on the ground floor. 

Each scent in Cloon Keen is inspired by an element of Irish culture.

Where to Shop in Galway

Cloon Keen Perfume

Cloon Keen Perfume shop is Galway’s answer to Le Labo. The mirrored store features rich perfumes and candles, each scent modeled after Irish culture and more memorable than the last. Antique Library is their bestseller, a smell inspired by a particular reading room inside the library of Dublin’s lauded Trinity College. Or Mountain Flower, an ode to Nora Barnacle, the Galwegian wife of James Joyce and the inspiration for a character in Joyce’s Ulysses.

Coffeewerk + Press

Part design shop, part artisanal coffee shop, Coffeewerk + Press is evidence that the bean scene in Galway is on the rise. With its minimalist Scandinavian design, the coffee shop is a quaint hideaway from the hustle and bustle of Quay Street. Order a flat white on their first floor, then head upstairs to their exceptionally curated design shop to admire their array of goods, from wool blankets to eccentric lamps, canteens, and design books.

entry.title: The 6 Best Wine Bars in Cape Town, According to Certified Sommelier Wayve Kolevsohn
entry.content:
Author: Tiana Attride 
Lead image: At Ellerman House, wine is always served with a view.

Sommelier Wayve Kolevsohn—the first woman in Africa to be certified by the Court of Master Sommeliers—shares her guide to Cape Town’s best wine bars.

“As a South African growing up in Cape Town, wine is ingrained into our culture,” says wine sommelier Wayve Kolevsohn. “I had my first sip of champagne when I was two—I have a photograph to prove it!”

The first woman in Africa to pass the Court of Master Sommeliers’ certification exams, Kolevsohn got her start in Franschhoek in the Cape Winelands. For three years, she worked as the restaurant manager at Le Quartier Francais’s former Tasting Room at a time when the idea of a sommelier was uncommon in the region. “As a San Pellegrino World Top 50 restaurant, we offered wine pairings with our 12-course tasting menu and had a rather substantial wine list. I assumed the additional role of wine service manager in the evenings, and that is where my passion and love for the South African wine industry began.”

Wayve Kolevsohn, the first woman in Africa to be certified by the Court of Master Sommeliers.
Kolevsohn currently works as the sommelier at Ellerman House—arguably one of the most stunning places one could enjoy a bottle in Cape Town.

Now the sommelier at Cape Town’s Ellerman House hotel, Kolevsohn’s lifelong love for South African grapes continues to thrive in the city’s robust wine scene. 

“In the Cape, wine is not just a drink—it’s a lifestyle, a way of life,” says Kolevsohn. “It’s actually more about the people, the land, and the culture rather than what’s in the bottle. It’s all of the above that makes what’s in the bottle so special, and that’s what I fell in love with.”

Here, Kolevsohn shares the six wine bars around Cape Town that have continued to foster her fondness, including a stop with views of boats sailing past Table Mountain and another offering some of the continent’s best seafood.

At Publik, lounge outside to enjoy some sunshine or head indoors for more intimate imbibing.
The food at Publik is just as attractive as its revolving wine list.

1. Publik Wine Bar

Always a buzz at this trendy wine bar, the wine list is constantly revolving; you will find something new every time you visit. Plus, the bar food alone is worth going for.

2. Tamboerswinkel

On Kloof Street, with a great selection of natural wines available by the glass and lovely outdoor area. The staff is always on hand for a wine chat.

3. Bascule Bar at the Cape Grace

The most perfectly sophisticated setting to enjoy a glass of wine or a cocktail whilst watching yachts come and go and beautiful views of Table Mountain.

Home to over 9,000 wines, Ellerman House is the premier hotel for wine lovers in Cape Town.
Inside Ellerman House, Kolevsohn hosts daily wine tastings for in-house guests.
Guests can also make themselves comfortable on the terrace by pairing a glass of wine with a dazzling sunset.

4. Ellerman House

Our wine gallery is home to over 9,000 bottles of wine. There is an ever-evolving wine list with a wonderful selection of wines by the glass. The sommelier (me!) hosts bespoke daily wine tastings for our in-house guests, and the terrace at Bar Roc is the perfect setting to watch the sunset with a glass of great South African wine. If you’re feeling a bit wined out, don’t forget the complimentary gin trolley with a huge selection of local South African gin and tonics.

5. Openwine

Run by an Italian couple Rafael and Marta. They have two venues: their Wale Street bar is in the hub of the city and their Woodstock store at The Old Biscuit Mill. A huge selection of wine by the glass. Both venues are the place to go for industry events and tastings. At Openwine you are never just a customer, you’re always made to feel part of their family.

6. Chapman’s Peak Restaurant and Hotel in Hout Bay

Not only is the seafood some of the best in Africa and does the setting offer views of Hout Bay Beach and the Atlantic Ocean, but the wine list is thoughtful and condense. Compiled by the owner and available for retail sales at their wine store next door, there is a wine for every palate and budget.

entry.title: Tourists Welcome: A Rustic Oasis in the Berkshires
entry.content:
Author: Ally Betker
Lead image: Because of the neutral color palette, nature lends the predominant pop of color— especially when the leaves change colors in the fall.

“We thought that it would be kind of funny to call a spade a spade,” says Ben Svenson, lead partner and visionary behind Tourists, a new hotel in North Adams, Massachusetts. “We like the challenging nature of taking a word that has a negative connotation and being forced to reconsider it.”

It seems like everyone is reconsidering North Adams lately, from visitors to the increasingly popular Massachusetts Museum of Contemporary Art (MASS MoCA) to the buyers behind the rise in single-family home sales. Tourists, which opened in July, puts the city and its surrounding areas firmly back on the map.

The design of Tourists in the Berkshires leans heavily on pine and white oak, which are found all around New England.

The five partners behind Tourists—Svenson; brewery owner Eric Kerns; chef Cortney Burns; John Stirratt, a founding member of the Grammy Award-winning band Wilco; and founder of Brooklyn Magazine and Northside Media Group Scott Stedman— describe the 48-room property as a post-Airbnb hospitality experience with modern design elements contrasting artfully with the woodland trails, riverbank vistas, and sculptural installations that surround the hotel. A 1962 ranch house that stood there previously has been repurposed into the hotel’s central lodge, which Stedman calls the “community living room, a place to congregate casually and share time with friends or meet new people.”

“We celebrate the idea of leisure travel as a tourist, embracing the most remarkable aspects of a region,” he continues. “North Adams is such a spectacular and unusual convergence of art and nature, and we felt that being a tourist here is a really remarkable experience. We wanted to create a brand that exemplifies that.”
